item.title: What’s Included in Project Zomboid Build 42?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/whats-included-in-project-zomboid-build-42/

For those of us still actively playing Project Zomboid and eagerly awaiting the launch of Build 42, some good news finally arrived from developer The Indie Stone. Project Zomboid Build 42 is officially on the unstable branch, available to download and play now, but with a few caveats. First and foremost, it’s only available in unstable as a work in progress, and the build does not work with current saves or mods, so clear your files!

Everything Added to Project Zomboid in Build 42 (Unstable)

Build 42 is positively massive, with so much new content that ensures Zomboid feels like an entirely new game. We have an expanded map with new locations and towns, underground zones, better lighting, a new build menu, lore, wild animals, crafting mechanics, and performance optimizations, to name but a few of the big changes!

  • Expanded Map
  • Additional Towns & Locations
  • Underground Areas
  • Basements
  • High Rise Buildings
  • New Lighting System
  • Darker Nights
  • Performance Optimizations
  • Animal Husbandry – Cows, Pigs, Sheep, and Chickens
  • Wild Animals – Deer, Rats, and Rabbits
  • Fishing Mechanics
  • Expanded Lore – Newspapers, Flyers, Television, and Radio
  • New Building Menu
  • Initial Crafting – New UI, Surface Crafting, Pottery, and Blacksmith Tech Trees
  • Improved Agriculture and Crops
  • Dynamic Music
  • Player Vocals
  • New Clothing, Containers, Weapons, and Objects
  • Better UI Scaling
  • Randomized Wilderness and Biomes
  • Basic Tracking and Hunting Mechanics
  • New Seated Animations
  • Better Gunplay
  • Corpse Dragging
  • Window Chucking
  • Romero-like Zombie Spawns
  • Improved Sneaking
  • Combat Balancing
  • Environmental Story Improvements

What’s Coming to Build 42?

Well, that’s quite a lot available on the unstable branch, but it’s only the beginning for Build 42!

  • Expanded Crafting
  • Additional Skills
  • New Professions
  • Improved Hunting
  • Breakable Metal Fencing
  • Multiplayer Reintroduction
  • Raccoons
  • And more (???)

What are you most looking forward to from Build 42 in Project Zomboid? Let us know in the comments below, or visit the community forum to discuss the ultimate zombie survival game with others!

If you love zombies as much as we do, don’t forget to check out how to unlock Mustang & Sally in Black Ops 6 Zombies!

item.title: G2 Esports Reportedly Foils Falcons’ Plans to Acquire Both of Their CS2 Superstars
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/g2-will-reportedly-keep-cs2-superstar/

G2 Esports will reportedly hold on to Russian CS2 superstar and AWP sensation Ilya “⁠m0NESY⁠” Osipov during this upcoming post-Major roster shuffle. Team Falcons, who reportedly have already gotten the other G2 superstar Nikola “⁠NiKo⁠” Kovač to join them in 2025, will have to look elsewhere.

While these moves are not official yet, they will drastically shake up the CS2 landscape at the start of 2025.

G2 lock down ⁠m0NESY⁠

The 19-year-old sniper superstar has been highly sought after by the Saudi Arabian for some time. Given his fondness for playing alongside NiKo, many speculated that m0NESY would depart alongside him. HLTV reported that ⁠m0NESY⁠ “considered” Falcons offer to join the roster as part of a massive overhaul.

With NiKo garnering a reported $1 to $1.2 million transfer fee, m0NESY could easily fetch an even higher price from Falcons. He finished the the 2024 season as one of the consensus best players in the world. With m0NESY signed to G2 for the rest of 2025, the organization has opted to turn down Falcons’ offer and keep him. G2’s goal for 2025 is to make m0NESY the focal point of the roster, and they’re risking him leaving after 2025 as a free agent to do so.

The hope for G2 now is that Mario “malbsMd” Samayoa can step into the star position left vacant by the departing NiKo. malbsMd had a breakout performance at the Perfect World Shanghai Major, and if he takes on a bigger role while m0NESY stays, the offseason becomes far less daunting for G2.

Falcons are no strangers to getting spurned while pursuing superstars, as they notably failed to acquire NiKo from G2 last year. The organization will now have to look elsewhere for an AWPer, having terminated legendary AWPer Oleksandr “s1mple” Kostyljev’s loan from NAVI back in November.

Is G2 doing the right thing by keeping m0NESY? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

Stay tuned to Insider Gaming for the latest esports news. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
